title: The Block's Scott Cam admits the Oslo Hotel was 'too big' of a project
text:
It's been a mammoth project of renovations for the contestants on this season of The Block.

And now the show's host Scott Cam has admitted they bit off more than they could chew tackling the Oslo Hotel in St Kilda.

Speaking to Channel Nine's Today show on Wednesday, the handyman, 56, told hosts Deborah Knight and Tom Steinfort: 'If no-one finishes [the renovation] I'll put my hand up and say it was too big, which it is too big.'

'We won't do a block this size ever again': The Block's Scott Cam has admitted the Oslo Hotel was 'too big' of a project for this year's contestants

'It's too big. We won't do a block this size ever again. There's no doubt about that.

'But I only need one team to finish to prove that it's not too big,' the TV presenter added.

When asked about who he thought would finish first, Scott showed no favoritism, saying: 'Everybody has got a chance to complete it.'

Mammoth renovation: The handyman, 56, said of the St Kilda building, 'It's too big. We won't do a block this size ever again. There's no doubt about that'

'Whether they do it to a level they want it finished, I don't know. Everybody has got a chance to finish. No doubt about that, whether they do to that level.'

With season 15 set to wrap up in the coming weeks, Scott also revealed he is already working the next season.

'I'm flying to Melbourne right now. Going to airport. Doing something for The Block, yes, next season,' he admitted.

Who will it be? Scott showed no favoritism when asked about who he thought would finish first, saying: 'Everybody has got a chance to complete it' (Pictured: Season 15 cast)

The revelation comes after realestate.com.au recently reported that five homes in Brighton, Melbourne will be renovated in the next season of the show.

It was reported that Micjoy Pty. Ltd., a company owned by Nine, purchased a property for $14.96million.

The network plans to subdivide the land to fit five homes, with an estimated value of $4.5million each.
description: It's been a mammoth project of renovations for contestants on this season of The Block.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
